titleStmt.title: Index des termes du projet EHRI 'Édition de premiers témoignages de l'Holocauste'
Index of terms from the EHRI project 'Edition of Early Holocaust Testimony'

note.p: Refers to legal acts (Rechtshandlungen) and court proceedings (Gerichtsverfahren).
A leader of a "Kreis" (county) in the Nazi party.
Local groups of the Nazi party.
The head of a county in parts of Germany and in occupied German territories. In Poland subordinate to a Gouverneur des Distrikts.
Jewish corps burning units in Death Camps see also Arbeitskommandos.

item.name: Council of the Elders/Jewish self administration

note.p: Refers mainly to forgeries of documents (including food stamps, vouchers etc.) as a means of resistance

item.name: Prisoners from the Protectorate of Bohemia and Moravia

note.p: Anti-Jewish acts performed with or without appropriate legislation.
For non-Jews see "Armband (for non Jews)"

item.name: Desecration of Jewish religious texts and objects

note.p: A Nazi term for people of mixed descent.
Nazi term for people administratively considered as Jews.

item.name: Antisemitism, Racism, Fascism, and National Socialism

note.p: Forced labour enforced by Nazi authorities.
Group of camp inmates working outside of the camp or in sub/satellite camps.
Refers to "Judenhaeuser" in Germany and the special houses in Hungary.
Hungarian and Romanian formations.

item.name: Cover up of traces of murder

note.p: Transfer from one place to another or one camp to another.
People placed in charge of confiscated property.
"Free of Jews" (a Nazi term).

item.name: Persecution of Christians of Jewish origin

note.p: Discrimination of the politically different.
An Orthodox Jewish college or seminary; for studying Talmudic texts.
Books or artefacts relating to Judaism
emigration to mandatory Palestine/Israel.

item.name: Jewish aid, health and rescue organisations

note.p: Zionist agricultural training centres.

item.name: Final Solution of the Jewish Question
